unnormalised: Hey everyone, some exciting news from the renewable energy sector! India's push for cleaner power is really picking up steam.
normalised: Hey everyone, some exciting news from the renewable energy sector! India's push for cleaner power is really picking up steam.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at IIT-Delhi just announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency, potentially reducing costs by 15%! Imagine the impact!
normalised: Doctor Sharma at I I T-Delhi just announced a breakthrough in solar panel efficiency, potentially reducing costs by fifteen percent! Imagine the impact!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Rajasthan is becoming a hub for wind energy. A new wind farm spanning 500 sq ft, near Jaisalmer, is projected to power approximately 20,000 homes in nearby villages.
normalised: Meanwhile, Rajasthan is becoming a hub for wind energy. A new wind farm spanning five hundred square feet, near Jaisalmer, is projected to power approximately twenty thousand homes in nearby villages.

unnormalised: The government has allocated Rs. 2,500 crore towards grid modernization to better handle the influx of renewable energy sources. This includes upgrading infrastructure and integrating smart grid technologies.
normalised: The government has allocated rupee two thousand five hundred crore towards grid modernization to better handle the influx of renewable energy sources. This includes upgrading infrastructure and integrating smart grid technologies.

unnormalised: Even smaller initiatives are making a difference. Many villages are now using solar-powered irrigation pumps, reducing their reliance on diesel.
normalised: Even smaller initiatives are making a difference. Many villages are now using solar-powered irrigation pumps, reducing their reliance on diesel.

unnormalised: This shift aligns with India's commitment to achieving net-zero emissions. And who knows, maybe soon we can all enjoy cleaner air and a brighter, greener future, just like those Diwali lights we love. Let's hope so!
normalised: This shift aligns with India's commitment to achieving net-zero emissions. And who knows, maybe soon we can all enjoy cleaner air and a brighter, greener future, just like those Diwali lights we love. Let's hope so!
